name: keephyp
params: class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3
body: -| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w1)), wb(w2, w0))
-| wi(wceq(c1, cif(c0, c1, w1)), wb(w3, w0))

stmt.origin: ifboth(c0, c1, w2, w3, w0, w1)
stmt.pretty: ifboth(c0, c1, w2, w3, w0, w1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(w2, w3), w0)
-| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w1)), wb(w2, w0))
-| wi(wceq(c1, cif(c0, c1, w1)), wb(w3, w0))

cumulated.origin:
|- w0
-| w2
-| w3
-| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w1)), wb(w2, w0))
-| wi(wceq(c1, cif(c0, c1, w1)), wb(w3, w0))

comment: Transform a hypothesis ` ps ` that we want to keep (but contains the same class variable ` A ` used in the eliminated hypothesis) for use with the weak deduction theorem. (Contributed by NM, 15-May-1999.)
